name: Chateau d'Artigny

reviews.text: Chateau D'Artigny seems to evoke mixed reviews--all the way from "most wonderful hotel ever" to "way overpriced and I'd never go back." Based on my experience I think a lot depends upon how you set your expectations. This place first captured my attention in a Relais and Chateau guide in the late 70s/early 80s. I gazed longingly at the picture and realized we just couldn't afford it and soothed my longing by thinking the staff was probably snooty. Over the years I repeated the experience until recently when I noted that it had disappeared from the guide. I wondered whether they had decided they didn't need the Association and were above all that or if somehow they'd been "drummed out" of the guide for not keeping up to standards.
reviews.title: Long-awaited dream come true

likes.disliked: — The road to the chateau which was really bumpy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got to planning a trip to Paris and the Loire with our daughter and son-in-law (they are expecting twins in November and won't be able to make our customary holiday trip with them) I decided it would be great to give them an extra special experience (and to satisfy my own long-held enchantment) by booking our two nights in the Loire Valley at Chateau D'Artigny.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before booking, however, I came on Trip Advisor to check out the reviews and ran into the seesaw effect explained above--great, not worth it, fabulous, not so hot, etc, etc. I concluded that the basic structure and elegance I'd longed for was probably still there but that I'd best temper my expectations a bit and hope for the best. The approach worked perfectly.
reviews.title: Utterly disappointing

likes.liked: — The bar area - really nice. Proximity to Montbazon village which was quaint

reviews.text: Besides the reviews here, my first inkling that the place might not be up to the mythical perfect hotel I'd once built up in my mind was when I saw that I could book a double room for 210 euros. Figuring back to the 70s/80s when I first checked this place out against others and it was among the most expensive of the Loire chateau hotels, I'd have guessed that by now the going rate for a double would be at least 350 euros--not 350 dollars given the current exchange rate. This was great since at 350 euros we'd certainly not have been able to afford to book 2 rooms for 2 nights, but at 210 as a celebratory splurge related to the impending opportunity to become grandparents for the first time, we could and would do it. Yeah!! I'd finally get to stay at the Artigny.
reviews.title: Truly wonderful

likes.liked: — Lovely dinners in elegant dining room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was wonderful. Plain and simple wonderful. The sight of the place as we drove up to it from the wooded entry all but took my breath away. The lobby was everything an elegant hotel should be. The welcome was warm and efficient and the peak into the fantastic dining room confirmed that I'd done the right thing. The kids were pretty well blown away with the elegance and my daughter was delighted to learn that such an old-fashioned elegant place still had an up to date fitness room.
reviews.title: Consider staying but do NOT eat here

reviews.text: We were very much looking forward to our stay, having had a wonderful experience here many years ago. But we were dissappointed. The bulding is still grand and the grounds lovely, but the service has really gone downhill, especially in the dining room. We had our worst meals of our trip at their dining room, even though they were the most expensive. And they rushed us through the meals too, which is hard to do given the expected pace of service in France. For breakfast, once they discovered that a lot of Americans were at the hotel, they added Coke and potato chips to the breakfast buffet! And they replaced the fresh squeezed juice they had used before the tour group arrive with some mix. At one meal, we ordered a drink that never came, and when we asked about it, it still never came. But we were billed for it nonetheless! And more than once we were presented with dishes intended for another table. I was also upset that even though I arrived on a Friday afternoon and had asked about wine tours, I was not told about the hotel's own cellar tour held once a week that very night, which I missed as a result. Finally, most of the rooms are not air conditioned, so if that is an issue beware. I wish I had better news to report, as my previous stay many years ago had been lovely.
reviews.title: Not What It Used to Be

reviews.text: We stayed one night in this chateau during our honeymoon, a self-guided bike tour. As we were riding our bikes towards the entrance, I knew we had arrived. The grounds and exterior are breathtaking. Inside, we were treated wonderfully by the staff, who were busy but very helpful. The interior of the chateau was just as beautiful as the exterior. Sky-high ceilings, stunning windows, gorgeous "public" rooms - particularly the domed room on the second floor and the breakfast room. Our guest room had similarly high ceilings and tall windows and was a good size, not large, but not small. The bathroom was very clean and included a shower/tub and vanity table. We had a memorable, fabulous dinner in the restaurant. The wine steward suggested a wine that was our favorite of our trip. The cheese and desserts were outstanding. We were sorry to leave the next day as we knew the next chateau we would stay in could not possibly compare to the Chateau d'Artigny. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a recent visit to the Loire region. The staff was truly terrific. They worked hard to make my wife and I happy. The receptionist was extremely accommodating and even entertained my mediocre French language skills admirably. Our room was new--not in the chateau itself. We had a separate shower, tub, and commode. Fairly luxurious accommodations, but not the chateau experience from the brochure. Chateau d"Artigny should advise their guests if a room is not in the chateau itself.
reviews.title: Nice, but...
Romantic Chateau
reviews.text: Food in the main dining room is very good, but the selection is perhaps not quite as good as I hoped. On evening 2 of our stay, my wife and I wanted something a little less grand than the traditional a la carte menu in the main dining room, and all they could come with was a cold meat plate. We would have been happy with salads, but this was not a possibility. Plus, the dining room needs a little help from an interior decorator if the chateau hopes to contend for ratings in the Michelin Guide.

My wife and I stayed here on our Honeymoon and loved it. The chateau was built in the 1920s and was built to look like a chateau, or more accurately, what you expect a chateau to look like. It is on a hill up a curving road. The grounds are beautiful and the hotel is grand with long corridors and stately staircases. The top floor has a painted dome ceiling with characters at a costume ball staring down from above.
reviews.title: Beautiful!! ... but questionable

reviews.text: This was an extremely disappointing experience. The property and the common rooms are beautiful; the guest rooms are a disaster. They are old, rundown, and are not clean. There is absolutely nothing luxurious about the accomodations. I asked to see other rooms and they were as equally gross. This place is completed overrated. The staff is very rude. There are much better choices in this region.
reviews.title: Avoid at all costs San Francisco, CA

likes.disliked: — The guest rooms were the most unappealing I have ver seen

reviews.text: We just spent 4 nights at this hotel and while we generally enjoyed our stay, it was by no means a wow! The hotel is located centrally in the Loire valley, but its not terribly easy to get in and out of (its about 20 minutes south of Tours, on the outskirts of the small village of Montbazon. The rooms were nice but not in the best condition. Our beds had brown wool blankets which weren't terribly clean, and on top were what appeared to be mini-duvets that werent even covered.
reviews.title: Ok, not great

likes.liked: — nice ambience of an old chateau hotel. central location

reviews.text: The staff was polite, but did not go out of their way to assist. When I asked about hot air baloon rides, they handed me a brochure and went on their business. The one computer in the hotel was down the entire time and they didnt appear in a rush to have it repaired. We were almost turned away from the hotel's restaurant since my teenage son had shorts on (thankfully they approved of his shirt). They claimed that this was a 4-star restaurant and dress code was enforced. After I insisted that we had no other clothing in our suitcase they finally relented to "make an exception" and let us in, but put us at a side table. The food was very good, but the experience somewhat dampened.
reviews.title: Avoid this place! Overrated in the extreme!

likes.liked: — The building looks good from a distance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We subsequently stayed at another hotel of the same chain - the Chateau D'Esclimont near Chartres and had a much better experience. There the rooms were 100 euros less (240 vs. 330), with breakfast included (vs. 21 euros at this hotel). The staff was much more welcoming, and even upgraded our room for free. The restaurant was just as good and dress code wasnt an issue. Clearly a difference between the two establishments...
reviews.title: Pure Luxury

likes.disliked: — Breakfast was too overpriced for the variety

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without a doubt THE most overrated establishment in which my wife and I have ever had the misfortune to stay (a view shared by the two relatives with whom we were travelling at the time). The place looks magnificent but don't be fooled by the photographs. The rooms are perfectly comfortable, but the decor has been applied rather like someone trying to "do up" an appartment in a hurry and on the cheap. Service was poor and very slow. Dinner in the restaurant was memorably awful. The only good thing was the entree. All four of us are real foodies, so are undoubtedly critical, but the rest of the meal (everything) was truly poor and the service was unbelievably inattentive and slow. Worse still, when some of our criticisms were voiced to the head waiter he was rude and even personally insulting to my Danish brother-in-law. I would go so far as to say that this hotel is all show and no substance - avoid at all costs!
reviews.title: Really good value for the money

reviews.text: I wanted to like this hotel more, I really did. It's a beautiful building in a beautiful location. Magical even. But when I got there, I was told they didn't have my reservation. They told me it was no problem and could give me a junior suite for 460 euro. when i produced my document with the confirmation number and a price of 360, the somewhat snooty girl at the desk said, "Okay, we'll give it to you for 360." So basically, she was going to rip me off by 100 euros if I hadn't had my confirmation with me. Then I was put into a huge room, but it was on the end of the building and didn't have any views over the gorgeous property. Just of the road I drove in on. Dinner was excellent however, I recommend the garden menu. And the dining room staff was very attentive. If you plan to go to this hotel, bring your confirmation with you and ask for a room in the center of the hotel with a view.
reviews.title: beautiful location, but questionable staff
Okay, but not amazing
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chateau d'Artigny on our honeymoon for a few days before heading to Paris. The location is great for exploring the countryside. We did not try the restaurant, as we were usually traveling. I was a little disappointed because the hotel was completely & literally empty while we were there, and they did not offer an upgrade. Our room was a traditional room, and was quite small, even in France. The bathroom was a decent size, though. And the bed was very comfortable. The grounds are lovely, as is the building itself. It was not a bad experience, but for the price, we could have done better. Other than the sheer prettiness of it, nothing particularly stands out about the room or the service.

reviews.title: A delightful time at the Chateau d'Artigny
reviews.text: The Chateau d'Artigny was magical. I had been there for a concert as a student 34 years ago and went back on a nostalgic trip. We went with friends and stayed overnight. They immediately upgraded our room as the hotel wasn't full. We were also celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. We had dinner at the chateau and it was outstanding (albeit expensive). The wine was fabulous and the cheese cart beyond belief! They were so gracious when they heard our story and provided us with champagne and a cake "gratuit". A really nice side trip from Paris.

reviews.title: Oh My God!!
reviews.text: Tremendous property fit for royalty. Stayed here just one memorable night during a self-guided bike tour through the Loire. Extremely attentive staff. Food remarkable. Do not miss this one if traveling through Loire.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: Service great, room beautiful, people really treated us like Kings, when we were dressed like backpackers and after a 6 hour drive in 40 degree (100 fahrenheit) heat.

description: Elegant castle hotel with spa located south of Tours, Loire ValleyThe white stones of the majestic Artigny Castle, the dream Belle Époque castle of François Coty, the famous perfumer, may be seen from a distance as they rise above the Indre Valley. Twenty-five hectares of park containing a French garden, marble statues, woodwork and trompe l'oeil frescos.
